page.title: 03LAND RECLAMATION,FLEETWOOD
page.content: New land has been created on the west banks of the{River Wyre}by waste ash from the boilers of the power station, (demolished in 1984).The ash was mixed with water,and spread layer by layer, onto the sand banks.The land was sown with grass and was then used for the grazing of cattle.However,the cattle began to show sign of weakness and they were removed. Scientists,from Lancaster University found,at first, little animal life. However after a few months,worms and other insects were observed.Cattle once again were allowed to graze,this time with no ill effects. The{Central Electricity Generating {Board,}left two lakes on the site as a bird sanctuary.Seagulls,which used to rest and feed on the sea shore,now prefer this area which is near the Fleetwood tip.
